Puglisi’s seven-year-old casual wine bar offshoot of Relæ still feels pretty radical. Chefs from around the world have filled their tables with his family-style plates of charred veggies, that famous beef tartare, and bottles of natural wine, then went forth to spread the gospel. (At least that’s our take.) Puglisi makes this destination feel like a neighborhood spot as locals often stop for takeout (pro hotel tip!).ORDER THE: beef tartare; short ribs with rhubarb chutney; and potatoes with fermented mushroom cream. But if you can’t decide: Get the family-style tasting for the table.THE VIBE IS: casual, fun, easy—though if you didn’t reserve, getting a seat requires patience. Bonus: International food hipster is spoken here.PRACTICAL STUFF: Open every day for lunch, from noon to 3:30 p.m., and dinner, from 5 p.m. to 10 p.m.—Christine MuhlkePhoto by Ditte IsagerPhoto by Ditte IsagerWE ALSO LOVEMirabellePlan a mini croissant- and yogurt-filled vacation at this café-like spot in NørreboroRelæLive a little with the Nørrebro tasting-menu restaurant that’s still making waves BæstPizza perfected in Inner NørrebroExplore City GuidesAtlantaAustinBostonCharlestonChicagoCopenhagenLas VegasLondonLos AngelesMexico CityMiamiMontrealNew OrleansNew YorkParisPhiladelphiaPortlandSan FranciscoSeattleTokyoTorontoVancouverWashington, D.C.GET THE MAGAZINEBA LogoBon appetitSUBSCRIBESign up for Updates on the Bon AppétitCity GuidesSign UpWill be used in accordance with our user agreement and privacy policyBA LogoBon appetitSubscription FAQsMastheadNewsletter SignupAccessibility HelpRSS FeedsSite MapCondé Nast StoreCareersBon Appétit Media KitDo Not Sell My Personal InformationCondé NastFood Innovation Group: Bon Appétit and Epicurious© 2022 Condé Nast.
